cont.entity_b: MediaPad consumes batteries quickly with no off switch. Mouse and number pad have power switches for battery conservation. Great key touch, with power switches to conserve battery life.

cont.entity_a: Easy to use, though the 'WIN' key can be confusing.
System works brilliantly for operating a PC connected to a TV. Great for media center use with a small form factor.
cont.entity_b: Num pad doubles as a calculator with clock and temp read-out. Separate calculator feature is very nice.

cont.entity_a: Requires learning its best response. Low profile and not very visible on a flat surface. Not suitable for production due to minimal key travel and touch-sensitive keys. No numerical keypad, affecting usability for number-heavy tasks. The keyboard has a slight curve but lacks ergonomic benefits. Touch-sensitive function keys are overly sensitive and awkward.
cont.entity_b: Setup is essentially a laptop keyboard size of a regular keyboard. Detachable keypad is a great feature for limited desk space. Keys feel great, but the '0' key on the keypad is often hit by mistake. Quiet and easy to use. Trim and solid with a nice key feel. Does not always recognize key presses.

cont.entity_b: Feels uncomfortable due to its small size. Works well on various surfaces. Does not track well on oak tabletops.

cont.entity_a: Takes time to get used to, with shifted keys causing typing errors. Great for use on a lap or desk.
cont.entity_b: Spacebar sticks, affecting typing speed and accuracy. Spacebar issue is common and affects usability.
